text: I have a white green and red salad the
first what I would call the white salad
uses frisée fennel and shaved parmesan
reggiano I'm making single servings
today so just a piece of this here like
this and for the fennel just a portion
here and you can sort of just go about
peeling the outside fennel does have a
core so you'll also want to cut that out
just at the very base here also the tops
need to be removed but you should
reserve some of the fronds they have a
really nice mild fennel flavor and they
look beautiful when you build your
salads and then this can just be very
thinly sliced that looks good and for
the presentation
start with the frisée and then your
thinly sliced fennel shaved parmesan
reggiano you could also use pecorino
romano and those fennel fronds that we
reserved and then to dress it I like
white wine vinegar a drizzle a little
olive oil of course extra-virgin always
salt and pepper
oh yeah that looks very tempting okay
the next salad the green salad these are
mini cucumbers which I love because you
don't have to peel the skin they have a
great texture perfectly edible seeds and
with this baby spinach you could use
another baby green
um arugula is wonderful here even
dandelion greens and the cucumber and
these pepitas that have been toasted
they're nutty they have a great texture
and there are an excellent substitute
for sunflower seeds and again you want
to dress with salt and pepper always and
I think for this salad I love a mustard
vinaigrette
this one is Martha's favorite that you
can find on our website and it's Dijon
mustard white wine vinegar olive oil
salt and pepper and that's it beautiful
right and for the last salad the red
salad a head of radicchio and apple this
is a gala but you could use any crisp
tart sweet apple and a red onion and I
feel like I'm about to juggle but I'm
not okay slice the radicchio it has a
core so cut around it radicchio is quite
strong so you'll want to shave it very
very thin a little bit of this goes a
long way and the Apple you can just cut
right around the core and our third red
ingredient of the red onion like the
radicchio it's quite strong so you don't
want a ton of it I'm just gonna cut a
cheek from one side very thinly sliced
okay you just plate them all together
the radicchio makes for a good bed
scattering onion and apple throughout
for this a lemon vinaigrette lemon juice
generous drizzle of extra virgin olive
oil again and of course salt freshly
ground pepper and there you have it a
trio of fresh and vibrant Lee colored
three ingredients salad happy eating
